arguments.name: COMMAND
arguments.description: The command or script to run.

description: Run a command or script in a virtual environment.

options.name: --python
options.description: Request a specific Python version. The requested version must be available in the search path or will be downloaded.

options.name: --isolated
options.description: Run the command in an isolated environment, ignoring the current virtual environment.

options.name: --target
options.description: Run the command or script against the given target (e.g., `.` or `pyproject.toml`).

options.name: --package
options.description: Install the given package into the environment prior to running the command. The package will be installed into an ephemeral environment, unless combined with `--target`.

options.name: --from
options.description: Install the given package into the environment prior to running the command. The package will be installed from the given requirements file (`requirements.txt`) or `pyproject.toml` file (`pyproject.toml` or `project.dependencies`).

options.name: --with
options.description: Declare package requirements for the runtime environment.

options.name: --no-project
options.description: Ignore the `pyproject.toml` file in the current or ancestor directories.

options.name: --no-cache
options.description: Avoid reading from or writing to the cache.

options.name: --verbose
options.description: Use verbose output. Takes precedence over `--quiet`.

options.name: --native-tls
options.description: Use the operating system's native TLS implementation.
